page.title: 06Carlisle Public Houses
page.content: The Lanes Redevelopment{(see pp4-5) retained two existing buildings on the Lowther Street frontage, the Appletree Inn and the Howard Arms. Both were once{State Management Scheme}pubs de- nationalised in 1971.The Appletree was designed by the noted architect{Harry {Redfern,}but the interior has been re- modelled and the name updated to "Pippins".Other Redfern exteriors can still be seen at the Malt Shovel in Rickergate and the Moorish style Cres- cent ("Carousel") in Warwick Road, next to the Head Post Office{( p14 ) The first SMS "food tavern" was also in Lowther Street, a Redfern convers- ion of the old Post Office into the Gretna Tavern (now the "Shambles".) Original coloured ceramic tiles on the front of the Howard Arms have been restored by the present owners.
